en_content:
Hail Mary, full of grace,
the Lord is with thee.
Blessed art thou amongst women,
and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus.
Holy Mary, Mother of God,
pray for us sinners,
now and at the hour of our death.

Amen.

The Angel of the Lord declared unto Mary,
And she conceived of the Holy Spirit.

Behold the handmaid of the Lord,
Be it done unto me according to thy word.

And the Word was made flesh,
And dwelt among us.

Pray for us, O holy Mother of God,
That we may be made worthy of the promises of Christ.

Let us pray.

Pour forth, we beseech thee, O Lord, thy grace into our hearts,
that we, to whom the Incarnation of Christ thy Son
was made known by the message of an angel,
may by his Passion and Cross
be brought to the glory of his Resurrection.

Through Jesus Christ, our Lord.

Amen.

Remember,
O most gracious Virgin Mary,
that never was it known
that anyone who fled to your protection,
implored your help,
or sought your intercession
was left unaided.
Inspired by this confidence,
O Virgin of virgins, my Mother,
to you I come,
before you I stand, sinful and sorrowful.
O Mother of the Word Incarnate,
despise not my petitions,
but in your mercy hear and answer me.

Amen.

O Mary, dawn of the new world, Mother of the living, to you do we entrust the cause of Life.

Look down, O Mother, upon the vast multitude of children not allowed to be born, of the poor whose lives are made difficult, of men and women who are victims of inhuman violence, of the elderly and the sick killed by indifference or by a misguided pity. Grant that those who believe in your Son may know how to proclaim to the people of our time the Gospel of Life.

Obtain for them the grace to accept it as a gift ever new, the joy of celebrating it with gratitude throughout their lives and the courage to bear witness to it with active tenacity, so as to build, together with all people of good will, the civilization of truth and love, to the praise and glory of God the Creator who loves life.

en_title: Prayer for the Month of Mary
en_content:
Hail Mary of our home,
woman, my human sister,
through you God comes to dwell
in our earthly abode.
With you, the land of the living
becomes the cradle of God.

Hail Mary of our home,
humble woman, my human sister,
through you God draws near
from the heaven of His great power.
With you, the land of the living
becomes the throne of God.

Hail Mary of our home,
woman of every day,
my human sister,
through you God comes to seek
the forgotten of every day
to seat them at His side
close against His cheek.
With you, the everyday earth
becomes space and time.

Holy Mary, Mother of God,
keep for me a child's heart,
pure and transparent as a spring;
obtain for me a simple heart,
that savors not sadness;
a heart magnificent in giving itself,
tender to compassion,
a heart faithful and generous
that forgets no good deed
and holds no grudge for any wrong.
Make for me a heart meek and humble,
loving without seeking return,
joyful to disappear in another heart
before your divine Son;
a heart great and untamable,
that no ingratitude can close,
that no indifference can weary;
a heart tormented by the glory of Jesus Christ,
wounded by His love
and whose wound may be healed only in heaven.

en_title: Prayer of Bishop Michel Dubost for WYD
en_content:
Mary, Mother of the Church,
Our Lady of Dance and Joy,
Our Lady of the Yes,
You, the young woman whom God trusted,
You, who trusted and believed,
We entrust to you the youth of the whole world.

Mary, Mother of the Church,
Our Lady of the Road and of Life,
Our Lady of the Yes,
You, the woman who brings forth the Word of God
And knows that she alone can build fraternity,
We entrust to you our meeting.

Mary, Mother of the Church,
Our Lady of Welcome,
Our Lady of the Yes,
You, the Mother who listens to your Son even to the Cross
And accepts receiving John and all men as sons,
We entrust to you the organization of the World Youth Days.

en_title: Prayer for the Feast of the Assumption
en_content:
We greet you, O Immaculate One, Mary, full of grace,
you who, from the first instant of your existence,
from your conception, were preserved from all sin,
for you were to become the Mother of the Savior.

Help us to turn towards your Son Jesus
and to turn away from sin.
Teach us to pray for sinners as you taught Bernadette,
for you are the Mother of the Redeemer and our Mother.

We greet you, O Mary, light of blessed faith,
through your glorious Assumption
the Father of Mercies has clothed you in your soul and in your body
with the splendor of the unique day of the Resurrection.

Strengthen our faith, that it may imbue with its light and its truth
our understanding, our actions and our service in this world,
for you are the Mother of the fairest of the children of men and our Mother.

We greet you, Holy Virgin,
you whom the Spirit of holiness has filled with charity and filled with all graces.
Teach us docility to the Spirit of Love, that we may be filled with true charity.

Grant us compassion for all suffering
and an insistent prayer for peace,
for you are Mother of Mercy and our Mother.

We greet you, Mother at the foot of the Cross,
Faithful Virgin, Mother of the Church.

Teach us to love her and to serve her
as the very Body of your Son given for us and the salvation of the world,
for you are the Mother of the Lamb and of the Shepherd and our Mother.

We greet you, Radiant Dawn of Salvation,
through your glorious Assumption,
you announce and precede the glory in their soul and in their body of all your children,
for you are the Mother of the World to come and our Mother.

I choose you today, O Mary,
in the presence of all the Heavenly Court,
for my Mother and Queen.

I deliver and consecrate to you,
in all submission and love,
my body and soul,
my interior and exterior goods,
and even the value of all my good actions
past, present, and to come,
leaving you the entire and full right
to dispose of me
and of all that belongs to me,
without exception,
according to your good pleasure,
for the greater Glory of God,
in time and in eternity.

Amen.

Immaculate Conception,
Queen of Heaven and Earth,
Refuge of sinners and most loving Mother,
to whom God willed to entrust the whole order of Mercy,
behold me at your feet, I, N..., a poor sinner.
I beg you, accept my whole being
as your possession and property;
act in me according to your will,
in my soul and my body,
in my life and my death and my eternity.

Dispose of me above all as you desire,
so that at last there may be accomplished in you what was said of you:
"The Woman shall crush the serpent's head,"
and also
"You alone shall conquer heresies throughout the world."

That in your most pure hands, so rich in mercy,
I may become an instrument of your love,
capable of reviving and fully blossoming
so many tepid or misguided souls.
Thus the Reign of the Divine Heart of Jesus will spread without end.

Truly, your presence alone draws graces
that convert and sanctify souls,
since Grace springs from the Divine Heart of Jesus
upon us all,
passing through your maternal hands.

en_content:

en_title: O Mary, Lady of Sorrows and of Hope
en_content:
O Mary, Immaculate Virgin,
Lady of Sorrow and of Hope,
be benevolent towards every person who suffers
and grant to each one the fullness of life.
Turn your maternal gaze
especially upon those who, in Africa,
are in extreme need,
because they are afflicted with AIDS or another
fatal disease.
Look upon the mothers who weep for their children,
look upon the grandparents deprived of sufficient resources
to support their orphaned grandchildren.
Embrace them all in your motherly heart.
Queen of Africa and of the whole world,
Most Holy Virgin, pray for us!

O Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ, Priest,
you who accompanied your Son in his mission to save mankind,
intercede with Him, that in this third millennium,
He may continue to call more young people to the priesthood and consecrated life.
Ever encourage those who have been called, protect them in their formation,
and accompany them on their path to holiness.
O sweet Virgin Mary!

en_title: Consecration of the Family to the Heart of Mary
en_content:
O Virgin Mary,
we consecrate today our home
and all who live in it to your Immaculate Heart.
May our house be like that of Nazareth,
a dwelling of peace and simple happiness,
through the fulfillment of God's will, the practice of Charity,
and complete abandonment to divine Providence.
Watch over all who live in it:
help them to always live Christianly; envelop them all in your maternal protection
and deign in your goodness, O Virgin Mary,
to reform in Heaven our home here below consecrated forever to your Immaculate Heart.
Amen.

O Mary, at the heart of the world,
at the beginning of time,
at the dawn of our lives.

Mary in the night of Bethlehem,
who gives the earth to God.

Mary, tenderness and faithfulness,
holding Life in our human hands.

Mary, gentle and fragile,
the strength and the light,
poor and humble,
the glory and the richness.

Mary, at the foot of the cross,
mother and daughter, alone,
pierced and radiant,
human in your suffering,
divine in your face.

Mary, Mother of our Savior,
yourself a savior for our world in disarray.
Mary, daughter and Mother of our humanity,
at the foot of our cross.

Mary, our strength and our light,
our glory and our richness.

Mary, on Easter morning,
discreet and almost absent.
Mary of days of rejoicing,
happy and forgotten.
Mary, our joy, our smile,
hand extended to the sinner,
succor of the afflicted,
Mary - pardon.

Mary, on the evening of Pentecost,
bulwark of the apostles, our support
in the turmoil of our uncertainties.

Mary, our hope,
who gives each day to the world
our divinity. Amen.

Virgin Mary, Mother of fair love,
Mother who never forsakes
a child who cries out for help,
Mother whose hands never cease to serve
your beloved children,
because they are moved by divine love
and the boundless mercy that flows from your heart,
turn your compassionate eyes toward me.
See the snarl of knots that stifle my life.
You know my despair and my pain.
You know how much these knots paralyze me.

Mary, Mother to whom God entrusted
the task of untying the knots in the lives of your children,
I place the ribbon of my life in your hands.
No one, not even the Evil One,
can take it from your merciful help.

In your hands, there is no knot
that cannot be undone.
Mother all-powerful, through your grace
and by your power of intercession
with your Son Jesus, my Liberator,
receive today this knot (name it if possible)

For the glory of God,
I ask you to undo it,
and to undo it forever.
I hope in you.
You are the only comforter God has given me,
you are the fortress of my weak strength,
the richness of my poverty,
the deliverance from all that prevents me from being with Christ.

Receive my call.
Keep me, guide me, protect me.
You are my sure refuge.
Mary, Undoer of Knots,
pray for me.

Amen.

You, ever awaiting
God's will for you,
Help me to answer "yes" joyfully as you did.

You, so receptive to God's signs in your life,
Deepen faith in me.
Grant me, without fear,
to dare to look at them and give thanks.

You, the joy of God,
Lead me into your great hidden silence,
of humility and gentleness,
and give me the joy of hearing myself
told again: "You are loved!"

You, bearing with your Son
the sufferings of humanity,
Place in my heart the listening and
friendship that every person needs.

You, the first who believed,
You, our Mother,
Tell me again each day:
"Do not fear!
Rejoice!
You are full of grace, for He lives all with you!"

Mary, Mother of Jesus, Mother in faith
and disciple of your Son,
you who allowed Jesus in the home of Nazareth
to grow in age, maturity, and grace,
we entrust to you all mothers.
May they learn from you
faithfulness to their mission,
may they be for those
they have brought into the world
givers of life
every day of their existence
through their listening and their tenderness.
May they learn from you to be attentive
to what grows and matures
in the hearts of their children,
may they also know how to receive as much as to give,
may they know how to recognize
the riches of the heart and spirit
of those whom they have
the mission to help grow.

Hail, Mary, Mother of God, venerable treasure of all the universe, light that is never extinguished, You from whom was born the sun of justice, scepter of truth, indestructible temple. Hail, Mary, dwelling place of Him whom no place can contain, You who have made to grow an ear of corn that will never wither.

Through you, the shepherds have given glory to God; through you, in the Gospel, is blessed He who comes in the name of the Lord. Through you, the Trinity is glorified; through you, the Cross is adored in the whole universe. Through you, the heavens exult; through you, fallen humanity has been raised up. Through you, the whole world has finally known the Truth. Through you, throughout the Earth, churches have been founded.

en_title: Consecration to the Immaculate Heart of Mary (Prayer of Fatima)
en_content:
Virgin Mary, Mother of God and our Mother, we consecrate ourselves to your Immaculate Heart, to be fully offered and consecrated to the Lord.

Through you, we will be presented to Christ, your Son and the only Son of God, and, through Him and with Him, to his Eternal Father.

We will walk in the light of faith, hope, and love, so that the world may believe that Christ is the one sent by the Father, from whom He came to transmit the word to us.

We also will be His envoys, so as to make Him known and loved to the ends of the earth.

Thus, under the maternal protection of your Immaculate Heart, we will be one people with Christ who acquired us by His Death, witnesses of His Resurrection, and through Him offered to the Father for the glory of the Most Holy Trinity, whom we adore, praise, and bless.

Amen.

en_title: Prayer for the Month of May
Mary, Through You God Speaks to Us
en_content:
Our Lady of Transparency,
in you and through you God speaks to us:
grant us a simple heart,
fill us with gladness.
O Virgin of the "Yes" and of the Magnificat,
make our hearts transparent like yours.

Our Lady of Humility,
hidden in the crowd, enveloped in mystery,
help us to carry the Good News to the world
and to immerse ourselves in the mystery of Christ
so as to communicate something of it to our brothers and sisters.

Our Lady of Fidelity,
You who ceaselessly sought the face of the Lord,
You who accepted the mystery
and meditated on it in your heart,
You who lived in accordance with what you believed,
You who were the very example of constancy
in trial as in exaltation,
help us to keep our commitments
as good and faithful servants,
until the last day of our life on earth.

en_title: Mary, I gaze upon you and say thank you.
en_content:
Thank you for having borne Jesus,
for having brought him into the world, raised him,
and for having accepted his death for us.

Mary, I look at you and I admire you.
I admire your faith, your meditative silence,
your way of doing exactly
what the Lord expected of you.

Mary, I look at you and I pray that you help me
to understand Jesus well, to hear his calls,
to go to the end of what he asks of me at this moment.

en_title: Mother of Peace, we pray to you
en_content:
Mother, You who know what it means for a mother
to hold in her arms the dead body of her son,
of Him to whom you gave Life,
spare all mothers of this world
the death of their children,
the torments of slavery,
the destructions of war,
concentration camps, prisons.

Preserve for them the joy of bringing forth a human being,
of developing the life within him.
In the name of that life,
in the name of the birth of the Lord,
implore for us peace,
justice in the world.

Mother of Peace,
in all the beauty and majesty of your motherhood,
we beseech you,
be with us at every moment.
Grant that the year to come
may be a year of peace,
by virtue of the birth
and the death of your Son.
Amen.

And now, Mother of Mercy,
in the name of the surge of love
of your most pure spirit,
the moon prostrates itself at your feet;
in fervent supplications,
it calls upon you,
for you have been constituted Mediatrix
in its favor
before the Sun of Justice,
to see the light
and through your intercession
to obtain the grace of the Sun.
For He has loved you
more than any other creature
and He has adorned you,
clothing you with the robe of glory
and placing upon your head
a crown of beauty.

Mother of all our winding roads
and all our fractured lives,
grant us, full of grace,
to live in grace and to persevere.

Receive us with our daily problems,
our shortcomings,
our personal, family, and social crises.
Through your prayer, obtain for us justice.

We entrust and consecrate to you
all who are rejected,
all who long for shelter,
and all who feel alone.

Pour into all our hearts
the wisdom of peace,
the strength of justice,
and the joy of friendship.

Mary,
Mother of Jesus Christ
and Mother of priests,
accept this title that we give you
to celebrate your motherhood
and to contemplate near you the Priesthood
of your Son and of your sons,
holy Mother of God!

Mother of Christ,
you gave to the Messiah Priest
his body of flesh
through the anointing of the Holy Spirit
for the salvation of the poor and of men
with contrite hearts.
Keep priests in your heart and in the Church,
Mother of the Savior!

Mother of faith,
you accompanied the Son of Man to the Temple,
fulfillment of the promises made to our fathers.
Entrust to the Father, for his glory,
the priests of your Son,
Ark of the Covenant!

Mother of the Church,
in the Upper Room, among the disciples,
you prayed to the Spirit
for the new people and its shepherds.
Obtain for the order of priests
the fullness of gifts,
Queen of Apostles!

Mother of Jesus Christ,
you were with him at the beginning of his life
and of his mission,
you sought him, Master among the crowd,
you assisted him, lifted up from the earth,
consumed for the one eternal sacrifice,
and you had near you John, your son.
Welcome those called by the Lord,
at their first steps on their path,
protect their growth,
accompany in life and in ministry
those who are your sons,
O you, Mother of priests!

Our Lady of Life,
Thank you.
You accompany us
Day after day.
Sustain us in our Faith,
In our Hope
And in our Love.

Our Lady of Life,
You gave life to Jesus.
He is our Savior.
Protect us and sustain
Our families.

Our Lady of Life,
Pray for us.
Watch over our world.
Teach us
Trust and courage,
Availability and service.

Amen.

en_title: Mary, I look at you and I thank you.
en_content:
Thank you for having carried Jesus,
for having brought him into the world, raised him,
and for having accepted his death for us.

Mary, I look at you and I admire you.
I admire your faith, your meditative silence,
your way of doing exactly
what the Lord expected of you.

Mary, I look at you and I pray to you to help me
to understand Jesus well, to hear his calls,
to go to the end of what he asks of me at this moment.

en_title: Mary, You Who Were a Mother
en_content:
Mary, You who were a mother,
Did You also know these bitter mornings,
When Your child rejects,
Your open hand?

These somber mornings of disgust,
Enveloped in the opacity of despair,
Where everything seems tasteless.
Mornings as heavy as evening.

Mary, You the gentlest of mothers,
You never despair.
This morning, give me back,
A tear of that faith.

That I may welcome him,
Care for him and encourage him,
To tell him, yet again:
There, be careful, danger.

Then, let him go,
Where he has decided,
To force destiny,
On his path.

Wait without anguish for the day,
When sometimes wounded, damaged,
Finally he will accept the love,
That You have always given him.

In the quest for himself,
Place on his path, that he may love,

Those thirsting for love to share their sadness.
They will then help him discover his true wealth.

Today,
our gaze must be lifted
towards the heaven of all our hopes.

Mary, our sister Mary,
daughter of our earth,
is raised in glory
because she is also
the mother of our God.

Mary is the first
to be able to place her steps
in the footsteps of her Son...
...to the end of the journey.

Our paths, too,
lead to glory.
We do not see it,
but Mary tells us so
by her Assumption.

You, Our Lady,
strengthen in our hearts
faith and hope
and fill us with that love
which will conquer all death
on the day of our own assumption.

Mary, Mother of God,
what if, passing
over the weakness of my abilities,
I tried, following your example,
to adhere to the present Word?
Would I not then receive God
in a different way:
He would become what He was
in your arms, Mary,
for the shepherds and for the Magi,
a little child, a sign by which men
would enter into your joy and recognize
God-with-us.
Pray that it may be so,
Mary, my Mother and the Mother
of all men.

We entrust to you, O Mother, the world,
all people and all nations.
From famine and war, deliver us.
From nuclear war, from incalculable self-destruction, deliver us.
From sins against human life from its very beginning, deliver us.
From hatred, and from the debasement of the dignity
of the children of God, deliver us.
From every kind of injustice in social,
national and international life, deliver us.
From the ease with which we trample underfoot
the commandments of God, deliver us.
From our attempts to stifle in our hearts
the very truth of God, deliver us.
From sins against the Holy Spirit, deliver us.

Accept, O Mother of Christ,
this cry laden with the suffering of all people,
laden with the suffering of whole societies.
May there be revealed once more in the history of the world
the infinite power of merciful love!
May it halt evil! May it transform consciences!
In your Immaculate Heart may there be revealed
for all, the light of hope.

en_title: Prayer to the Virgin of the Poor
en_content:
Virgin of the Poor,
you came a long time ago,
to this wild and solitary place,
and since then you have not ceased to come,
you give signs to each of us,
you call us onto the path.
You smile at us, you say nothing,
you walk before us.
You lead us into the woods,
where the wind whistles,
where the Spirit blows,
where water springs from hidden lakes.

Virgin of the Poor, we thank you
for having come and for coming still
to relieve our solitude
and put us back on the path,
to dispel our doubts and anxieties,
and to open us to the Beatitudes.

Virgin of the Poor,
teach us to pray more,
to believe without reserve,
to cry out from the depths of our mire,
poor and sinners that we are,
prisoners of our comfort,
so that we may open our door,
that we may open our borders,
that we may open our hearts
to the calls of our Father
and to the distress of our brothers and sisters.

At the hour of my death,
O Mary,
whom I have so often invoked,
be near my bedside.

Be there as my mother would be
if she were still alive.

Perhaps my paralyzed tongue
will no longer be able to pronounce your name
but my heart will always repeat it...

I call upon you now
for that dreaded moment.

Will I be alone,
expiring far from all help?...
alone without a friendly hand
to close my eyes?

I will die smiling,
because you will be there.

I hope so.

I believe it.

I am sure of it!

O Virgin Mary, Daughter of the Father, Chosen by the Eternal One,
To be His child,
And thereby suffer for us.
Most Holy Virgin Mary, I beseech you,
Have pity on our souls,
Intercede for us
With the Most Holy Trinity,
And I am certain that you will obtain from Jesus
the grace..., which I so ardently desire.
Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit,
Now and forever,
world without end.
Amen.

Holy Virgin,
amidst your days of glory,
do not forget the sorrows of the earth.
Turn a gaze of kindness
upon those who are suffering,
who struggle against difficulties
and who ceaselessly steep their lips
in the bitterness of this life.
Have pity on those who loved each other
and are separated!
Have pity on the loneliness of the heart!
Have pity on our faith!
Have pity on the objects of our tenderness!
Have pity on those who weep,
on those who pray,
on those who tremble!
Give to all hope and peace.

Immaculate Queen of heaven and earth, refuge of sinners and most loving Mother to whom God willed to entrust the entire order of mercy, behold me at your feet, I a poor sinner.

I beg you, accept my entire being as your possession and property, act in me according to your will, in my soul and in my body, in my whole life, my death, and my eternity.

O Beloved Mother, you who know so well the ways of holiness and love, teach us to raise our minds and hearts often toward the Trinity, to fix upon It our respectful and affectionate attention. And since you journey with us on the path of eternal life, do not remain a stranger to the weak pilgrims whom your charity is pleased to gather; turn toward us your merciful gaze, draw us into your light, inundate us with your sweetness, carry us into the light and into love; carry us ever further and higher into the splendors of the heavens.

May nothing ever trouble our peace, nor make us depart from the thought of God, but may each minute carry us further into the depths of the august mystery, until the day when our soul, fully unfolded in the illuminations of divine union, will see all things in eternal Love and in Unity.

Amen.

en_title: Prayer to Mary, Mother of Hope
en_content:
Mary, Mother of Hope,
walk with us!
Teach us to proclaim the living God;
help us to bear witness to Jesus, the only Savior:
make us helpful to our neighbor,
welcoming to those
who are in need, artisans of justice,
passionate builders of a more just world,
intercede for us
who labor in history,
with the certainty
that the Father's plan will be fulfilled.

Dawn of a new world,
show yourself the Mother of Hope
and watch over us!
Watch over the Church in Europe:
may it be transparent to the Gospel,
may it be an authentic place
of communion,
may it live its mission
of announcing, celebrating and serving
the Gospel of hope
for the peace and joy of all.

Queen of Peace,
protect humanity of the third millennium!
Watch over all Christians:
may they advance in confidence
on the path of unity,
as a leaven for concord
on the continent.
Watch over young people,
hope of the future,
may they respond generously
to the call of Jesus;
watch over the leaders of nations:
may they strive to build
a common home,
in which the dignity
and rights of each person are respected.

Mary, give us Jesus!
Make us follow him
and love him!
He is the hope of the Church,
of Europe, and of humanity.
He is the One who lives with us, in our midst,
in his Church.
With you, we say
"Come, Lord Jesus!" (Rev 22:20)
May the hope of glory
placed by him in our hearts
bear fruits of justice and peace.

Amen.

Be our intercessor, you, the Immaculate One,
to ask the Lord first for forgiveness of our faults:
our lack of listening, our impatience
with one another,
and with our children,
the love that we have not known how to share
today in our work and in our encounters.
Mary, with you, tonight, we want to say thank you!
Thank you for the joy that we experience within our home.
Thank you for the joy we have in sharing
with young people and for the help that the Lord gives us
in order to uphold our responsibilities.
You, Mary, who are mother, our mother and our model,
teach us to welcome others as they are,
with their difficulties and their joys.
Teach us to love them, to listen to them, to help them.
Tonight, what makes us sad,
is thinking of all those who are in sorrow:
the sick, the isolated, the children

who cannot taste the joy of a true home.
Help us to be present with them.
Help us to live a life of true Christians,
in our home, our neighborhood, our workplaces,
with children and young people.
Mary, we pray to you, we ask you
to make our children discover Jesus Christ
living in the events of every day.
Enlarge our heart!

Amen.

en_title: Prayer to Our Lady of Lourdes
en_content:
Mary, you appeared to Bernadette in the hollow of the rock.
In the cold and shadow of winter,
You brought the warmth of a presence,
Light and beauty.

In the hollow of our darkened lives,
In the hollow of the world where Evil is powerful,
Bring hope,
Restore trust!

You, who are the Immaculate Conception,
Come to the aid of us sinners.
Give us the humility of conversion,
The courage of penance.
Teach us to pray for all people.

Guide us to the sources of true life.
Make us pilgrims walking within your Church.
Sharpen in us the hunger for the Eucharist,
The bread for the journey, the bread of life.

In you, Mary, the Holy Spirit accomplishes marvels:
By his power, he placed you near the Father,
In the glory of your Son, forever living.
Look with tenderness
Upon the miseries of our bodies and our hearts.
Shine for all, like a gentle light,
At the passage of death.

With Bernadette, we pray to you, Mary,
In the simplicity of children.
Lead us, like her, into the spirit of the Beatitudes.
Then, we can, from here below,
Begin to know the joy of the Kingdom
And sing with you:

Magnificat!

Glory to you, Virgin Mary,
Blessed servant of the Lord,
Mother of God,
Dwelling place of the Holy Spirit!

en_title: O Mary, Help us to Welcome the Beatitudes
en_content:
Holy Virgin Mary,
you help us to welcome
the Sermon on the Mount,
those Beatitudes which are spoken of so much
and applied so little,
because they go against the current,
as if the Gave flowed back up
towards the glaciers of the Pyrenees.

Holy Virgin Mary,
you help us to become the People of the Word,
the people of the Eucharist, the People of the message.
What good is it to go ever faster,
if we do not know where we are going?
What good is it to produce ever more,
if we do not know how to share?
What good is it for the poor to become rich
and the rich to become poor,
if both
do not know how to live like Christ?

Holy Virgin Mary,
to a world dominated by money,
you teach your generosity.
To a world of tinsel and lies,
you show your transparency.
To a world that sneers and defiles,
you offer your purity.
Teach us not to be
a finished page ready to be printed
but a page each day completely blank,
where the Spirit of God
draws the wonders He works in us.

You are beautiful, O Mary,
you the reflection of the heart of God.

Your face is that of a mother
where the tenderness of God is reflected.
And that face nestled against yours
speaks of the desperate surge of trust
that throws the child against his mother.
That face is that of Jesus, your child,
of whom you are the throne in the heavens
as you were the haven on earth.

Those cheeks, one against the other,
vibrate mysteriously
with the beating of two hearts in unison.

But that face
which seeks place and refuge against yours,
is that of each one of us.

en_title: Holy Mary, Our Lady of Prayer
en_content:
You welcomed in faith the message of the angel Gabriel
and became the Mother of Jesus, the Only Begotten Son of God.
Teach us to pray, so that we may grow in faith.

At the Visitation, you exulted with joy in the Magnificat.
Teach us to give thanks to God.

At Cana, you prayed to Christ
that He might give the wine of the wedding feast.
Teach us to intercede for our brothers and sisters.

Standing at the foot of the Cross,
you suffered with Jesus out of love for sinners.
Teach us to receive the Father's mercy.

At Pentecost, you prayed with the Apostles
when they received the fullness of the Holy Spirit.
Teach us to ask for the Spirit
that we may witness to the Gospel.

You are the Mother of the Church and the Protectress of Families.
Watch over each of our families.
Teach us to love with faithfulness.

You are the Mother of humanity and the Patroness of France,
open our country to the universal dimensions
of God's love.
Teach us to serve with generosity.

O Mary, conceived without sin,
pray for us who have recourse to thee!
Our Lady of Prayer, teach us to pray.

en_title: Holy Mary, Companion on the Journey
en_content:
Holy Mary,
Mother both tender and strong,
our companion on the journey along the roads of life,
every time we contemplate
the great things that the Almighty has done in you,
we feel so keenly the regret for our slowness
that we feel the need to quicken our pace
to walk close to you.
Satisfy then our desire to take you by the hand,
and accelerate the rhythm of our steps, weary pilgrims that we are.
Having become pilgrims in faith ourselves,
not only shall we seek the face of the Lord,
but, contemplating in you the icon of human solicitude
towards those who are in need,
we shall reach the "city" in haste,
bringing to it the same fruits of joy
that you once brought to distant Elizabeth.

Virgin Mary, Star of the Sea, Queen of the Waves, You to whom sailors, even unbelievers, have always been devoted, look upon Your Sea Scouts at Your feet, who would like to raise themselves up to You.

Obtain for them a soul as pure as the sea breeze, a heart as strong as the waves that carry them, a will as taut as a sail in the wind, an attention that watches without weakening, like a lookout in the crow's nest, a body well-equipped for the struggles against the storms of life.

But above all, O Our Lady, do not leave them alone at the helm, let them avoid the reefs where they would run aground before anchoring near You in the harbor of Eternity.

Amen.

O Mary,
Dawn of the new world,
Mother of the living,
To you we entrust the cause of life:
Look down, O Mother, upon the vast numbers
Of babies not allowed to be born,
Of the poor whose lives are made difficult,
Of men and women who are victims of inhuman violence,
Of the elderly and the sick killed by indifference
Or by a false compassion.
Grant that all who believe in your Son
May know how to proclaim to the people of our time
With firmness and love
The Gospel of Life.
Obtain for them the grace to accept it
As a gift ever new,
The joy of celebrating it with gratitude
Throughout their lives
And the courage to bear witness to it
With active perseverance, so as to build,
Together with all people of good will,
The civilization of truth and love,
To the praise and glory of God, the Creator who loves life.

Amen.

Please, Virgin Mary,
ask Jesus to teach me
to make a beautiful silence like you.

Please, Virgin Mary,
ask Jesus to teach me
to listen to His Word like you.

Please, Virgin Mary,
ask the Holy Spirit to teach me
to keep the Word of Jesus
in my heart like you.

Please, Virgin Mary,
ask Jesus to teach me to say "yes"
with all my heart like you.

Please, Virgin Mary,
pray for us to the Lord Jesus.
He listens to you since you are His mother
and we are, we too, your children.

Alleluia.

Amen.

en_title: Falling Asleep in the Arms of Our Lady
en_content:
To fall asleep in the arms of Our Lady,
Like a little child,
To offer her one's soul,
One's love and trusting spirit.

To follow her in the night,
Without ever looking back,
To follow her in life,
Without ever ceasing to love.

To fall asleep in the arms of Our Lady,
The heart filled with hope,
To dry all tears,
To give meaning to existence.

To pray to her at all times,
Without ever doubting,
To pray to her earnestly,
Without ever denying her.

To fall asleep in the arms of Our Lady,
With unwavering fidelity,
To bow before her flame,
Where love bursts forth like a fire of straw.

To seek her in all situations,
To implore through her her Beloved Son,
To seek her without ever becoming discouraged,
On the paths of truth.

When the winds of temptation assail you,
when you see the pitfalls of misfortune appear,
look to the star, call upon Mary.

If you are tossed about on the waves of pride,
of ambition, of calumny, of jealousy,
look to the star, call upon Mary.

If anger, avarice, carnal seductions
come to shake the light vessel of your soul,
lift up your eyes to Mary...

In peril, anguish, doubt,
think of Mary, call upon Mary.
Let her name not depart from your lips nor your hearts!

And to obtain her intercession,
do not turn away from her example.

In following her, you will not go astray.
In imploring her, you will not know despair.
In thinking of her, you will avoid all error.
If she sustains you, you will not fall;
if she protects you, you will have nothing to fear;
under her guidance you will ignore fatigue;
thanks to her favor, you will reach the goal.

O Virgin, it grows late,
all sleeps upon the earth.
It is the hour of rest,
do not abandon me.

Place your hand upon my brow,
still my thoughts.

Place your hand upon my heart,
that it alone may ever beat and watch.

Place your hands upon my eyes
and gently close them
to the things of this world.

Sweet will be my rest
if it is blessed by you.

Amen.

en_title: Prayer to Our Lady of Africa
en_content:
Our Lady of Africa,
you who are mother of all people,
remember especially the Africans.

Bring back to unity
all those who follow Christ;
reunite them all in the Church founded by your Son.

May all those who do not recognize
in Jesus the Son of the Father
be drawn by his Light.

May all those who have allowed themselves to be seized by Him
proclaim his Good News
throughout their lives.
You, who were with the Apostles at the beginning of the Church,
sustain even now
the ardor of today's apostles.
May they proclaim the Word with assurance.

You who were available to the Holy Spirit
to welcome Jesus into yourself
and give him to the world,
obtain for many young people
this same availability.
Our Lady of Africa, Queen of Peace,
obtain Peace for all countries torn apart
by Hatred, Rancor, and Racism.

May the law of Charity of your Son
win hearts and unite them,
so that all may sing the glory
of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.

Amen

Lord, have mercy on us. (twice)
Christ, have mercy on us. (twice)
Lord, have mercy on us. (twice)
Christ, hear us. (twice)
Christ, graciously hear us. (twice)

God the Father of Heaven, have mercy on us.
God the Son, Redeemer of the world, have mercy on us.
God the Holy Spirit, have mercy on us.
Holy Trinity, One God, have mercy on us.

Holy Mary, pray for us.
Holy Mother of God, pray for us.
Holy Virgin of virgins, pray for us.
Mother of Christ, pray for us.
Mother of divine grace, pray for us.
Mother of the Church, pray for us.
Mother most pure, pray for us.
Mother most chaste, pray for us.
Mother inviolate, pray for us.
Mother undefiled, pray for us.
Mother most amiable, pray for us.
Mother most admirable, pray for us.
Mother of good counsel, pray for us.
Mother of our Creator, pray for us.
Mother of our Savior, pray for us.
Virgin most prudent, pray for us.
Virgin most venerable, pray for us.
Virgin most renowned, pray for us.
Virgin most powerful, pray for us.
Virgin most merciful, pray for us.
Virgin most faithful, pray for us.
Mirror of justice, pray for us.
Throne of wisdom, pray for us.
Cause of our joy, pray for us.
Spiritual vessel, pray for us.
Vessel of honor, pray for us.
Singular vessel of devotion, pray for us.
Mystical rose, pray for us.
Tower of David, pray for us.
Tower of ivory, pray for us.
House of gold, pray for us.
Ark of the Covenant, pray for us.
Gate of heaven, pray for us.
Morning star, pray for us.
Health of the sick, pray for us.
Refuge of sinners, pray for us.
Comforter of the afflicted, pray for us.
Help of Christians, pray for us.
Queen of Angels, pray for us.
Queen of Patriarchs, pray for us.
Queen of Prophets, pray for us.
Queen of Apostles, pray for us.
Queen of Martyrs, pray for us.
Queen of Confessors, pray for us.
Queen of Virgins, pray for us.
Queen of all Saints, pray for us.
Queen conceived without original sin, pray for us.
Queen assumed into Heaven, pray for us.
Queen of the Most Holy Rosary, pray for us.
Queen of peace, pray for us.

Lamb of God, who takes away the sins of the world, spare us, O Lord.
Lamb of God, who takes away the sins of the world, graciously hear us, O Lord.
Lamb of God, who takes away the sins of the world, have mercy on us, O Lord.

V. Pray for us, O Holy Mother of God.

R. That we may be made worthy of the promises of Christ.

Let us pray.

Grant, we beseech Thee, O Lord God, that we, Thy servants, may enjoy perpetual health of mind and body; and, by the glorious intercession of the Blessed Mary, ever Virgin, may be delivered from present sorrow, and enter into the joy of eternal happiness. Through Christ our Lord.

Amen.

Holy Mary, Mother of God,
keep in me a child's heart,
pure and transparent as a spring.

Grant me a simple heart,
that savors not sadness,
a compassionate heart,
a faithful and generous heart,
a heart that forgets no good
and bears no grudge for any wrong.

Grant me a meek and humble heart,
loving without seeking return,
a heart that no ingratitude can shut,
that no indifference can weary,
a heart to render glory to Jesus Christ,
a heart wounded by your love
and whose suffering will be eased only in Heaven.

Prayer of Father
Léonce de Grandmaison

Lead, Kindly Light, amid the encircling gloom,
Lead Thou me on!
The night is dark, and I am far from home;
Lead Thou me on!
Keep Thou my feet; I do not ask to see
The distant scene—one step enough for me.

en_title: Prayer to Our Lady of the Priests of Dachau
en_content:
Our Lady of Dachau!

Though we ourselves are in need of help, we dare to pray to you:
Go to aid and console those who are in need of your help. Behold, war rages, and millions of men suffer day and night in body and soul. Show yourself a mother and strengthen them.
Millions of men have lost their homes and wander destitute, among strangers. You knew this abandonment during your flight into Egypt: be their recourse and strength.
By all the sorrow that you endured beneath the Cross, we beg you to console the sick and the wounded, to give courage to the prisoners, and to assist at the hour of their death those who must die.

Many churches are closed or destroyed; many parishes are without a pastor. Everywhere Hell is waging its assault. Show that you are a mother, and protect the Church of your divine Son and its pastors. Protect also the priests who, at the front and in the hospitals, perform the office of the Good Samaritan. Give strength to the seminarians who aspire to ordination. Awaken vocations despite the difficulties of the hour, and take care not to let the ardor of faith and virtue be extinguished, nor fidelity to the Holy Church be broken.

Bless and strengthen our bishops in their heavy task. Protect and support above all our Holy Father, whose heart breaks at the thought of his powerlessness to relieve miseries, to calm sufferings, and to restore peace.

And if you pass there where our parents and our families, our flocks and those who have worked with us and who have prayed for so long for our return are, tell them, O Our Lady of Dachau, that you watch over us, now and at the hour of our death.
Our Lady of Dachau, in our extreme distress, show yourself a mother.

Amen.

O gracious Virgin Mary, the beauty and sweetness of your face
inspire in me trust and devotion.
Your presence is closer than my shadow.
The shadow of my doubts is dispelled
by your infinite light overflowing with purity.
O radiant Virgin Mary, the splendor of your Child Jesus
causes the rose of my heart to blossom.
The Lord our God vibrates in you, Mary,
and your Immaculate Heart vibrates in the depths of me.
O gentle Virgin Mary, subtly place your hands on my brow
so that they may pour upon me your holy blessings
and the gifts of the Holy Spirit that you received from the Father
on the day of the Annunciation.
O holy Virgin Mary, Mother of God, with humility
I prostrate myself at your merciful feet.
Enlighten me and guide me on the splendid path
that leads my spirit towards the Knowledge
of your beloved Son, our Lord Jesus Christ!
Glory to you, holy Virgin Mary, the fairest of mothers!

Amen

en_title: Prayer to Our Lady of Perpetual Help for Iraq
en_content:
Grant peace to the land of Iraq,
O Our Lady of Perpetual Help,
We entrust to your heart and your love
The Iraqi people and the Church of that land.
Protect them from all injustice,
From all division,
From all violence and from all war.
Protect them from the temptation
And the slavery of vengeance.
Be with them!
Help them to overcome doubt through faith,
Fear through trust,
Hatred through love.
O Mother of Christ,
Be their comfort
And give strength to all who suffer:
To the persecuted,
To the refugees.
Grant peace to this divided land
And to all, the light of hope.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.

Amen.

Our Father, who art in heaven,
hallowed be thy Name;
thy Kingdom come,
thy will be done,
on earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread,
and forgive us our trespasses,
as we forgive those who trespass against us,
and lead us not into temptation,
but deliver us from evil.

Amen.

I confess to Almighty God,
and to you, my brothers and sisters,
that I have greatly sinned,
in my thoughts and in my words,
in what I have done and in what I have failed to do,
through my fault, through my fault,
through my most grievous fault;
therefore I ask blessed Mary ever-Virgin,
all the Angels and Saints,
and you, my brothers and sisters,
to pray for me to the Lord our God.

I believe in God, the Father Almighty,
Creator of heaven and earth,
and in Jesus Christ, His only Son, our Lord,
who was conceived by the Holy Spirit,
born of the Virgin Mary,
suffered under Pontius Pilate,
was crucified, died and was buried;
He descended into hell;
on the third day He rose again from the dead;
He ascended into heaven,
and is seated at the right hand of God the Father Almighty;
from thence He will come to judge the living and the dead.
I believe in the Holy Spirit,
the Holy Catholic Church,
the communion of saints,
the forgiveness of sins,
the resurrection of the body,
and life everlasting.

Amen.

I believe in one God, the Father Almighty,
Maker of heaven and earth,
of all things visible and invisible.
I believe in one Lord Jesus Christ,
the Only Begotten Son of God,
born of the Father before all ages.
God from God, Light from Light,
true God from true God,
begotten, not made, consubstantial with the Father;
through him all things were made.
For us men and for our salvation
he came down from heaven,
and by the Holy Spirit
was incarnate of the Virgin Mary,
and became man.
For our sake he was crucified under Pontius Pilate,
he suffered death and was buried,
and rose again on the third day
in accordance with the Scriptures.
He ascended into heaven
and is seated at the right hand of the Father.
He will come again in glory
to judge the living and the dead
and his kingdom will have no end.
I believe in the Holy Spirit,
the Lord, the giver of life,
who proceeds from the Father and the Son,
who with the Father and the Son
is worshipped and glorified.
He has spoken through the prophets.
I believe in one, holy, catholic and apostolic Church.
I confess one Baptism for the forgiveness of sins
and I look forward to the resurrection of the dead
and the life of the world to come.

Amen.

Glory to God in the highest,
and on earth peace to people of good will.
We praise you, we bless you,
we adore you,
we glorify you, we give you thanks for your great glory,
Lord God, heavenly King,
O God, almighty Father.
Lord Jesus Christ, Only Begotten Son,
Lord God, Lamb of God, Son of the Father,
you take away the sins of the world, have mercy on us;
you take away the sins of the world, receive our prayer;
you are seated at the right hand of the Father, have mercy on us.
For you alone are the Holy One,
you alone are the Lord,
you alone are the Most High,
Jesus Christ, with the Holy Spirit,
in the glory of God the Father.

Amen.

My God, I am heartily sorry for having offended Thee, and I detest all my sins, because I dread the loss of heaven and the pains of hell, but most of all because they offend Thee, my God, who art all good and deserving of all my love. And I firmly resolve with the help of Thy grace to confess my sins, to do penance, and to amend my life. Amen.

O Jesus, Supreme King of the Church, I renew, in Your presence, my unconditional adherence to Your Vicar on earth, the Pope. In him, You have willed to show us the sure path we must follow amidst the confusion, anxiety, and discouragement. I firmly believe that through him, You govern us, teach us, and sanctify us, and that thus, behind him, we form the true Church: one, holy, catholic, and apostolic.

Grant me the grace to love, to live, and to propagate his teachings, as a faithful son. Watch over his life, illuminate his intelligence, strengthen his spirit, and defend him from calumny and malice. Calm the destructive winds of infidelity and disobedience and grant that, with him, Your Church may remain united and firm in its faith and works, and that it may thus be the instrument of Your Redemption.

Amen.

en_title: To the Father Who Calls Us
en_content:
Make us hear, our Father,
your call to justice
that takes no account of privilege
and gives to each their just share!

Make us hear, our Father,
your call to solidarity
that raises up the least and the hungry
in their dignified human stature!

Make us hear, our Father,
your call to love
that places upon every human being
the signs of your unwavering tenderness!

Our Father,
with the gifts that you have entrusted to us,
make us go forth, following your Son,
to work with your Spirit
for the harvests to come
of the earth finally transfigured
into your image and likeness.

My Father,
I abandon myself into Your hands;
I surrender myself to You, I trust in You.
Do with me what You will;
whatever You may do,
I thank You.

I am ready for all, I accept all.
Only let Your will be done in me,
only let Your will be done in all Your creatures,
I desire nothing more, O my God.

I place my soul into Your hands;
I give it to You, my God,
with all the love of my heart,
because I love You,
and because it is a need of love for me to give myself.
I surrender myself into Your hands with infinite confidence, for You are my Father.

My Father,

He takes me by the hand with gentleness and firmness,
Leading me on the path of life, the one that leads towards tomorrow.

Along the way, He helps me with patience
To overcome the obstacles encountered, and with Him as my guide,
I have confidence in my steps.

To the questions I ask myself, He answers simply,
And it is the words dictated by His heart that best
Soothe my torments.

When wrinkles deepen His cheeks and His brow,
I know that they will spare my heart,
So justly does this love He has given me flood it entirely.

en_title: It's Beautiful To Be Your Child
en_content:
Father, it is to you I turn this evening
with a quiet and peaceful trust.
Your Son taught me that you are my Father...
So I come simply to tell you that I am your child,
and I say it to you earnestly,
and yet with the desire to laugh and sing,
so beautiful it is to be your son;
but it is also serious,
for you have loved me so much, and I so little!

Father, make of me what you will.
Your will, I know, is that
I become like your Only-Begotten,
the elder brother who taught me your name:
that I walk on the same path.
I have no strength for this,
but I have yours...

Father, here I am:
work in me, carve and cut,
I will never do you the injury of being afraid
or of believing that you forget me;
and if I find the cross very heavy,
I can at least repeat to you tirelessly
that I believe in your love and that I accept your will.

I know, Father,
I never cease to grieve you,
but you will never cease to forgive me.
As for love, I will always be outdone;
yet not so, for you will give me your own.
You will give me your Love,
your Son in whom I can do all things.

en_title: Grant, O Father, that I may love You!
en_content:
O God,
I love only You alone.
I seek only You alone.
I wish to serve only You alone.
You alone must be my Master.

Drive vanity from me,
so that I may recognize You.
Tell me where to look to see You.
I hope to fulfill all that You expect.

Grant, O Father, that I may seek You,
preserve me from error.
That in my search,
nothing other than You may present itself to me.
If it is true that I desire nothing other than You,
Grant, O Father, that I may find You.

And if there were still in me
some superfluous desire,
deign to strip it from me Yourself
and make me capable of seeing You.

My Father,
guide me where Your Will desires me to go,
allow me to live in Your Light
and to warm my heart
so that it may be burning
and give warmth
to those who approach me.
Blessed be Your Name
for giving me all these Graces,
despite my nothingness.
Blessed be Your Name
for the good You have done me
and the Mercy You have shown me
in raising me near to Your Heart.

Amen.

en_title: O Father, All Praise Is Yours!
en_content:
O Father, to you be praise!
You show your way to the humble
But you hide it from the eyes of the wise
So that in the trial of hunger
They may seek your face.

O Father, to you be praise!
In you alone is our joy
Since you always receive us
When, wretched and without love,
We return to you.

O Father, to you be praise!
For you know our weakness
Like a mother you carry us
And at every moment you caress us
With your mercy.

O Father, to you be praise!
For your Love is infinite
You will for us holiness
And you give it to the little ones
In your Beloved Son.

Heavenly Father,
May Your Holy Name be blessed for the Joy of Your Love,
Your kingdom come in our hearts and in our minds
so that we may share in Your Love and Your creation
by sharing their fruits, in peace and fraternity,
such is Your holy will.

Loving Father, God of goodness and mercy,
You give us the Bread of Heaven,
saying to us: "If you will."
You offer us the Bread of Life
in the person of Jesus the Savior:
Jesus Love, I am not worthy to receive You,
send us the Spirit of Pentecost,
I will live Your Word
and proclaim it in the joy of Your Love.

Teach us to love and to forgive
as to share freely,
as You love and forgive infinitely.

Send the Holy Spirit our advocate
against temptation and our divisions.
Give us the Spirit of Life,
who preserves us from the death of unlove.

Deliver us from all the slavery
of evil and our passions,
through the merits of Your reconciliation.
Having become brothers and heirs of the Kingdom,
come to our aid to renounce our Ego.
Grant us to love You and to serve You more
in the love of our brothers.
Forgive us as we forgive.

For to You belongs the kingdom
in our hearts, the power of Love,
the praise of the universe, the glory of heaven.

From the depths of distress,
God without flaw,
I hope in you.
From the depths of death,
Secret God,
I love you.

Father of all expectation,
Whose heart is on the watch
To embrace the prodigal,
Whose tenderness, like a river,
Covers my deserts,
I hope in you.

Father of all pardon,
Slaying in the miracle of oblivion
All that is base,
God of lightness, God of dance,
Dazzling silence,
I hope in you.

Father of every dawn
Where your people take heart again,
Where peace blooms anew
As the day aspires to the day
After the wakeful night,
I hope in you.

From the depths of distress,
God without flaw,
I hope in you.
From the depths of death,
Secret God,
I love you.

Father in Heaven, thank you!
You have chosen us;
You have desired each of us, thank you!
Thanks to You, each receives his life
as a unique stone,
a magnificent stone
that comes to build up the body of Your Son.

Father in Heaven, thank you
for the Holy Spirit who sustains us,
for the Church who accompanies us
and helps us to find the place
where our stone will be most beautiful,
where each will give, as in transparency,
this love that he receives from You.

Lord, my Savior and my God,
You who delivered Israel from the clutches of Pharaoh,
You who felled Goliath before David,
You, the Mighty Companion and Protector of the Israelites,
You who conquered death,
From the debt of blood, deliver me,
From the chains of my sins, deliver me,
From the snares of the evil spirit, deliver me,
From greed, deliver me,
From injustice, deliver me,
From oppression, deliver me,
From death, deliver me,
From the hands of my enemies, deliver me,
From falsehood, deliver me,
From sloth, deliver me,
From discouragement, deliver me,
From sensuality, deliver me,
From illness, deliver me,
From fear, deliver me,

By Your Power, deliver me,
By Your Mercy, deliver me,
By Your Love, deliver me,
By Your Holy Sacrifice, deliver me,
By Your Holy Name, deliver me,
By Your Cross, deliver me,
By Your Wonders, deliver me,

God of Eternal and Almighty Love,
You, the Alpha and the Omega,
Hear the cries of your poor servant
and come to his aid through Jesus Christ,
the Lamb offered in supreme sacrifice.

Amen.

Thanks be to you for your Word, O God our Father,
where we gather the promise
of what you yourself wish to give us.

In the midst of our agitated, troubled lives,
knowing at times some joys
but so often great trials
of body, mind, or soul,
tormented by so many diverse things
in the tumult of the world that surrounds us,
we bless you for allowing us
to stop for a moment
to listen to what you have to say to us.

May the meditation of Your Word
truly place in our hearts
a new light which illuminates our path
during the days that are to come,
and make us capable of being in the world
better heralds of your love,
through our service, our witness,
and our own love.

Lord, here I am kneeling before you,
beseeching you for all my sins
that I have committed in thought, in word,
by action and by omission,
whether in offending you,
in offending my neighbors, or myself.

Lord God Almighty,
be always at my side,
may your light reach me,
I who am a sinner,
may your light open my eyes
to the wonders of the world to come,
my hands to charity.
Lord, my faith is weak,
increase my faith,
make my faith certain and unwavering.

Glory to you, God of Goodness,
Glory to you, God of Mercy,
Glory to you, God thrice Holy.

May your Kingdom come in this world,
May your will be done,
May men recognize Jesus as Savior,
He who has blotted out our sins.
Make us know our mission on this earth,
May your grace reach those who love you,
And your mercy those who disdain you.
Grant the sick healing,
to prisoners, freedom,
to the departed, eternal life,
to the hungry, the bread of life.

Cause love, faith, and charity to grow in us.
To you, God, be glory,
power, and dominion forever and ever,
Through Jesus Christ, the Lamb offered in Supreme Sacrifice.

Amen.

Take, Lord, receive all my liberty,
my memory, my understanding,
and my entire will.
All that I have and possess,
You have given it to me.
I return it all to You, O Lord,
and surrender it wholly to Your will.
Dispose of it according to Your good pleasure.
Give me only Your love,
give me Your grace,
for this is enough for me.

Eternal Father,
O Eternal Beauty,
O Eternal Wisdom,
O Eternal Goodness,
O Madman of Love,
Do You need Your creature?

Yes, I believe so, since You act
as if You could not live without her,
although You are Life,
the source of all life,
although without You
nothing can live.

Why then are You so madly in love with Your creature?
Why, since she flees You,
are You so enraptured with her salvation?
Why do You seek her?
The further she goes,
the closer You draw to her;
could You come any closer
than when You came in her humanity?

en_title: Prayer to the Father by John Paul II
en_content:
God, from whom all fatherhood takes its name
in heaven and on earth,
Father, who are Love and Life,
grant that every family may become,
through the grace of your Son, Jesus Christ,
and through the grace of the Holy Spirit,
a true sanctuary of life
and love for the generations
who ever succeed one another.

Grant that your grace may guide spouses
in their thoughts
and their actions for the good
of their families and of all
the families of the world.

Grant that the young generations
may find in the family
an effective support
that teaches them what
the human condition is and helps them
to grow in truth and love.

Grant that love may prove
stronger than all weakness
and every crisis which at times
besets our families,
through Jesus Christ our Lord,
who is the Way, the Truth, and the Life.

Our Father, who are Love,
we thank You for desiring us in Your Image
and for giving us the means to attain it,
by making us ever more responsible.

We ask You to give us
ever more strength not to stagnate
and to draw closer to Your Infinite Substance.

Deign to ask for us from the Most Holy Virgin Mary
the total help of Her Infinite Trust
to lead us to You.

In our days filled with pitfalls,
when we believe everything is collapsing,
yet close to us, You are there.

In the clear gaze
of a smiling child, You are there.

In our daily struggles
that we face head-on, You are there.

In the great joys of our lives, You are there.

In moments of solitude and discouragement,
close to us, You are there.

In the shared happiness of family, You are always there.

In our doubts that shake us, You are nonetheless there.

In our moments of contemplation and prayer,
you are at the heart of our lives, You are truly there.

In our wanderings and our selfishness,
you observe us attentively,
you await us patiently with open arms,
You are still there.

In our successes, you are always present,
close to us, You are there!
Thank you, Lord, for always being there close to me!

Amen.

Lord, here I am on my knees before you,
beseeching you for all my sins
which I have committed in thought, in word,
by action and by omission,
whether by offending you,
by offending my neighbors, or myself.

Lord God Almighty,
be always at my side,
may your light reach me,
I who am a sinner;
may your light open my eyes
to the wonders of the world to come,
my hands to charity.
Lord, my faith is weak,
increase my faith,
make my faith certain and unwavering.

Glory to you, God of Goodness,
Glory to you, God of Mercy,
Glory to you, God thrice Holy.

May your kingdom come in this world,
May your will be done,
May men recognize Jesus as Savior,
He who has erased our sins.
Make us know our mission on this earth,
May your grace reach those who love you,
And your mercy those who disdain you.
Grant to the sick healing,
to the prisoners freedom,
to the victims eternal life,
to the starving the bread of life.

Cause to grow within us love, faith, and charity.
To you, God, be the glory,
the power and the reign forever and ever,
Through Jesus Christ, the Lamb offered in Supreme sacrifice.

Amen.

Loving Father,
I need You, I rely on You
to exist and to live.
In Your Son Jesus, You have looked upon me
and You have loved me.
I have not had the courage to leave everything
and to follow Him,
and my heart has been filled with sadness.
But You are stronger than my sin.
I believe in Your power over my life,
I believe that You can save me as
I am now.
Remember me.

Forgive me!

en_title: Praised be God, the ingenious craftsman!
en_content:
With a barren couple, Abraham and Sarah, He brings forth a people.

With a stammerer, Moses, He makes a prophet.

With a young shepherd, David, He destroys tyrants.

With a deceived man, Hosea, He proclaims His faithfulness.

With a woman of loose morals, He evangelizes Samaria.

With cowards, He fashions the apostles.

From a renegade, He makes the first Pope.

A leader of anti-Christian raids becomes Paul, in love with God.

From a golden youth, filled with money and vanity, He makes for us a Francis of Assisi.

God chooses what is weak to confound the wisdom of the wise.

Blessed is he who believes that every human being, even the most vile, is invited to share in the intimacy of God forever.

God our Father,
Almighty and merciful, Creator of heaven and earth,
Hear the prayer of your children, let your light shine upon this city where, for centuries, so many men and women have sought to know and to love you.
Open the doors and hearts: that your Son may make his dwelling there.

Lord Jesus Christ,
You know our joys, our fears, and our distresses, Help us to recognize you, our Redeemer and our Savior.
Give us the desire for true life, Bless all who seek the truth,
Give strength and courage to all who work for the coming of your Kingdom.

Holy Spirit, Spirit of love,
Renew in your Church the wonders of Pentecost, here and now.
Prepare us to receive the gifts that you wish to offer us.

Holy Mary, Mother of the Redeemer,
we entrust to you the men, women, and children of this city.
Touch their hearts. Lead them to your beloved Son.

All you, Saints and Blessed,
You especially who have lived, studied the word of God, served the poor, and witnessed to the Gospel in our city,
Pray for us, bless us. May the work of God be accomplished in us and around us.

Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit, To the God who is, who was, and who is to come, For ages of ages,

Amen

Father, I ask You to bless my friends and family who are reading this prayer now. I ask You to provide for all their needs at this very moment. If they are suffering, grant them Your peace and Your love. If they doubt themselves, give them renewed confidence in Your ability to act through them. If they are weary and burdened, I ask You to grant them understanding, patience, and strength during these days when they are learning to follow Your way of the cross.

If they are stagnant spiritually, I ask You to renew them by revealing Your nearness and drawing them into greater intimacy with You. If they are afraid, reveal Your love and free them by giving them courage. If they are blocked by a sin that keeps them far from You, reveal it to them and break its hold on their lives.

Bless their financial situation and give them a better vision of what they should do with it. Raise up leaders and friends to support and encourage them. Grant each of them the discernment to recognize the evil around them and reveal to them the power they can find in You to overcome it.

I ask all this in the name of Jesus.

Amen.

My God, I firmly believe all the truths that you have revealed and that you teach us through your holy Church, because you can neither deceive nor be deceived.

In this faith, may I live and die.

Amen.

Ineffable Creator,
true source of light and wisdom,
graciously pour forth upon my intellect
a ray of your brightness,
and dispel from me the twofold darkness
of sin and ignorance.

Grant me penetration to understand,
capacity to retain,
method and ease in learning,
and eloquence in speech.

Direct the beginning, guide the progress, crown the completion,
You who are true God and true man,
living and reigning forever and ever.

Amen.

en_title: I Only Come To Look At You
en_content:
I have nothing to offer and nothing to ask,
I come only to gaze upon you.
To gaze upon you, to weep with joy, to know this:
That I am your son, and that you are there.
To say nothing, to look upon your face,
To let my heart sing in its own language.

Listen, my God!

I have never spoken to You before;
But now I desire to say to You:
"How are You?"
Listen, my God,
They told me that You did not exist,
And, like a fool, I believed it.
The other evening, from the bottom of a shell hole,
I saw Your sky…
Suddenly, I saw that they had told me
A lie.
If I had taken the time to look at the things You have made,
I would have clearly seen that these people refused
To call a spade a spade.
I wonder, my God, if You would consent
To shake my hand…
And yet, I feel that You will understand.
Strange that I had to come

To this hellish place
Before having the time to see
Your face.
I love You terribly, that's what I want You to know.
There is going to be a terrible battle now.
Who knows? It may be that I will arrive at Your home
This very evening.
We have not been friends until now
And I wonder,
My God, if You will wait for me at the door.
Look, now I am crying!
I, shedding tears! Ah! If I had known You sooner…
Come now, I must go!
It's funny, since I met You,
I am no longer afraid to die.

God, thank You!

en_title: My God, I adore your greatness
en_content:
My God, I am before you,
I collapse before you,
I adore your greatness,
my misery is immense,
have pity on me.
May your Spirit dwell within me,
may the Holy Spirit live within me,
so that I may love you and you may love me.
My God, may my heart be pure,
may my intention be right,
may my body be chaste.
My God, may no one suffer because of me,
may your truth illuminate me,
may your will be done.

My God, I hope with a firm confidence that You will grant me, through the merits of Jesus Christ, Your grace in this world, and, if I keep Your commandments, eternal happiness in the next, because You have promised it and are faithful to Your promises.
My God, I love You with all my heart, and above all things, because You are infinitely good and infinitely worthy of being loved, and I love my neighbor as myself for the love of You.

Come, O Creator Spirit,
visit the souls of your faithful,
fill with grace from on high
the hearts you have created.
You who are called Advocate,
Gift of the Most High God,
Living Fountain, Fire, Love,
and Unction spiritual.

You are the Spirit, sevenfold in your grace,
Finger of God’s right hand,
Promise of the Father,
You put light in our minds.

Enkindle your light in our hearts,
pour your love into our souls,
and strengthen our bodies in their weakness
by your perpetual power.
Drive far from us the foe,
grant us peace without delay,
so that under your guidance we may avoid
all that is harmful and perverse.
Teach us to know the Father,
reveal to us the Son,
and you, the Spirit of them both,
help us believe in you always.

Glory be to God the Father,
to the Son who has risen from the dead,
and to the Holy Spirit, the Advocate,
now and forever, world without end.

Holy Spirit,
fire kindled by the risen Jesus,
come and burn again today
in our young hearts
so that, leaving everything
to follow Christ,
we may discover the true joy of disciples.

Send us
into the midst of our brothers and sisters,
with the priests
in service of the people of God.
Send us
into the world,
with the men and women
with apostolic hearts.

Send us
beyond the borders,
with the witnesses consumed
by missionary zeal.
Send us
into the silence of the desert
with the passionate seekers
of the living God.

Spirit of Holiness,
Come fill our hearts,
Throughout our lives,
Reveal Your power.

Spirit of Holiness,
Come fill our hearts,
Make us each day
Witnesses of the Lord.

You are the Light
That comes to enlighten us,
The Liberator
Who comes to deliver us,
The Consoler,
The Spirit of Truth,
In You, hope and fidelity.

Spirit of Holiness,
Come fill our hearts,
Throughout our lives,
Reveal Your presence.

en_title: Holy Spirit, Soul of my Soul
en_content:
Holy Spirit,
Soul of my soul, I adore You.
Enlighten me, guide me,
Strengthen me, console me,
Tell me what I must do,
Give me Your commands.

I promise to submit myself
to all that You desire of me
and to accept all
that You will permit to happen to me,
only make Your will known to me.

en_title: Holy Spirit, teach us to see the signs You send us.
en_content:
Holy Spirit, You are the Fire,
You are Love, You are Joy,
You dwell within me.

I sometimes feel Your presence
in that gladness that radiates from my heart.
But, too often, I let fall,
like a heavy lid,
the greyness of daily life, fatigue, weariness,
even anguish sometimes.
Teach me to recognize
all the signs of joy that You send me
through the beauty of the most humble things:
that rose blooming on my path,
those heaps of vegetables ablaze
on the market stalls,
that cloud edged with light which makes one believe in the sun.
Teach me to read Your reflection
in the eyes of my brothers and sisters:
that glance exchanged in passing,
that moment of dialogue, on the sidewalk,
which illuminates a gloomy morning,
the smile of that child in the metro,
who responds to mine and plants
a big kiss on my cheek,
that friend overwhelmed with tenderness who opened her heart to me
and seemed relieved by it.

You are there, of course, in the tenderness of all my loved ones,
but also in their absence
when You make them present to me.
You are there in this work over which I struggle
and I know well that it is You
who give me the strength to go all the way.
Teach me to thank You with joy
for the task accomplished in love.

You are there when I strive to pray
and my mind wanders over so many distractions;
You call me tirelessly.
From my dryness and my poverty,
raise up a praise to the Father.
You will be there when Christ takes me by the hand
to draw me into Trinitarian Joy.
Help me to open my heart wide
to sing with You.

Alleluia!

en_title: Holy Spirit, Master of the Impossible
en_content:
Holy Spirit,
You who are from eternity the master of the impossible,
come accomplish in us all that is possible for you:
revive what is dying,
cause to blossom what is germinating,
bring to maturity what has fallen to the earth.

Be in us the Spirit of the Father;
come convince us to give our life
and to collaborate in the great work of creation,
from the earth to be transformed
to the lands to be shared among us.

Be in us the Spirit of the Son:
come teach us to pass through the Cross
to open the way to your Kingdom
and to live in trust
trials as well as joys.

Be in us the Spirit of holiness,
who initiates us into the ways of God,
into the generosity of the Father, into the fidelity of the Son,
and also into the courage of the apostles
and into the praise of Mary.

Be in us the Spirit
who constantly makes a new humanity,
who recreates our freedoms when they unravel,
who maintains hope in the very heart of violence,
who despairs of no one,
not even those who expect nothing more from God.

Grant to each of us to find our place
in this great body of Christ
and to consecrate our whole being to its growth,
so that the world may have Life, True Life,
the Life that is found in losing one's own,
with you, thanks to you,

O master of the impossible!
Amen.

Who are you, sweet light, who fill me
and illumine the darkness of my heart?

Like a mother's hand, you guide me
and, were you to let me go, I would not know how to take another step.

You are the space enveloping my being
and sheltering it within yourself.

Should you reject it,
it would plummet into the abyss of nothingness
from which you drew it to raise it toward the light.

You, who are closer to me than I am to myself,
who are more interior to me than my own heart,
and yet ungraspable, inconceivable,
beyond all names,
Holy Spirit, eternal Love!

en_title: Invocation of the Spirit for an Examination
en_content:
Come, Spirit of Holiness,
Come, Spirit of Light,
Come, Spirit of Fire,
Come, set us ablaze!

Come, Spirit of the Father,
Make my work fruitful,
That I may lay it down
At the foot of the Cross.

Come, Spirit of Holiness.

Come, Spirit of the Father,
Fill me with Wisdom,
That which comes from God,
And not that of men.

Come, Spirit of Truth.

Come, Spirit of the Father,
Free me from pride,
Make me work
For the Glory of God.

Come, Spirit of Truth.

If I succeed,
Make me humble and gentle,
Make me recognize
That I hold everything from You!

Come, Spirit of Holiness.

And if I have failed,
Fill me with Patience,
Lead me towards
That which You want of me!

Come, Spirit of Holiness.

Come, Holy Spirit,
send forth from heaven
the ray of your light.
Come, Father of the poor,
come, Giver of gifts,
come, Light of hearts.

Greatest Comforter,
sweet guest of the soul,
gentle relief.
In labor, rest,
in heat, shelter,
in sorrow, solace.

O Blessed Light,
invade the inmost heart
of your faithful.
Without your grace,
there is nothing in us,
nothing that is not harmful.

Cleanse what is stained,
water what is dry,
heal what is wounded.
Bend what is rigid,
warm what is cold,
correct what is astray.

Give to your faithful,
who trust in you,
your holy gifts.
Grant them virtue,
grant them salvation,
grant them unending joy.

Amen.

Gift of the Most High God,
come into us,
source of graces,
come into us.
Sacred Fire, come into us.
Spiritual Anointing,
come into us.

Spirit of truth, come into us.
Spirit of wisdom and understanding, come into us.
Spirit of counsel and fortitude, come into us.
Spirit of knowledge and piety, come into us.
Spirit of fear of the Lord, come into us.

Spirit of grace and prayer, come into us.
Spirit of contrition and trust, come into us.
Spirit of gentleness and humility, come into us.
Spirit of peace and patience, come into us.
Spirit of modesty and purity, come into us.

Spirit Comforter, come into us.
Spirit of the Lord, who fills the universe, come into us.
Spirit of infallibility, who guides the Church, come into us.
Holy Spirit, hear us.

O Holy Fire,
Fire that consumes
all superfluities,
Fire that dispels all coldness,
Fire that perfectly consumes
the holocaust of our souls!

My soul longs after the Lord, and I seek Him with tears.
How could I not seek You? You first found me. You have given me to experience the sweetness of Your Holy Spirit, and my soul has loved You.
You see, Lord, my sorrow and my tears... If You had not drawn me by Your love, I would not seek You as I seek You. But Your Spirit has given me to know You, and my soul rejoices that You are my God and my Lord, and, even to tears, I long after You.
My soul longs after God, and it seeks Him with tears.
Merciful Lord, You see my fall and my pain; but, humbly, I implore Your clemency: pour out upon the sinner that I am the grace of Your Holy Spirit, whose remembrance leads my spirit to find Your mercy anew.
Lord, give me Your humble Spirit so that I may not lose Your grace again, and that I may not lament like Adam who wept for God and lost Paradise.

Open your hearts to the breath of God;
his life is grafted onto the souls he touches;
may a new people be reborn from the waters
where the Spirit of your baptisms hovers.
Let us open our hearts to the breath of God,
for he breathes in our mouths
more than ourselves!

Offer your hearts to the tongues of Fire:
may the heart of the earth finally burn;
your foreheads are marked with sacred signs:
the words of Jesus and of victory!
Let us offer our bodies to the tongues of Fire
that they may proclaim the mystery of our glory.

Surrender your being to the seeds of the Spirit
come to join all suffering;
the Body of the Lord is made of the sorrows
of the man crushed by injustice.
Let us surrender our being to the seeds of the Spirit
that he may give us his strength in his service.

Turn your eyes towards the interior Guest
desiring nothing but this presence;
live by the Spirit, to be the one
who gives his Name to your Father.
Let us turn our eyes towards the interior Guest,
for he dwells in our silences and our prayers.

The Spirit,
when He dwells in a man,
never leaves him
once that man has become prayer.
For the Spirit Himself
never ceases to pray within him.
Whether that man sleeps or wakes,
prayer henceforth
does not depart from his soul.

Whether he eats, whether he drinks, whether he sleeps,
whatever he does,
and even in deep sleep,
the perfumes and incense of prayer
rise effortlessly from his heart.

Prayer no longer leaves him.

en_title: To Receive the Gifts of the Holy Spirit
en_content:
O Jesus, who, before ascending into Heaven, promised your apostles to send them the Holy Spirit, to instruct them, console them, and strengthen them, deign to send down upon us also this divine Paraclete.

Come into us, Spirit of the Fear of the Lord; grant that we may fear above all else to grieve our heavenly Father and that we may flee the deceitful allurements of the pleasures of the senses.

Come into us, Spirit of Piety; fill our hearts with the most filial tenderness for God and with the most perfect meekness towards our brethren.

Come into us, Spirit of Knowledge; enlighten us on the vanity of the things of this world; grant that, seeing in them images of the divine perfections, we may use them to raise our hearts towards Him who created them for our service.

Come into us, Spirit of Fortitude; give us the courage to bear with patience the sufferings and trials of life, and grant that we may generously overcome all the obstacles that would stand in the way of the fulfillment of our duties.
